snippet: New experiments have found success in reducing congestion not by assessing fees but by offering discounts or cash to get drivers to change their habits.
abstract: Anti-congestion traffic program designed for Standford University by Prof Balaji Prabhakar rewards commuters by entering them into a $50 lottery if they shift their commute to off-peak times; program has proven far more popular than penalty systems that have been instituted in other areas around the world.
lead_paragraph: New experiments have found success in reducing congestion not by assessing fees but by offering discounts or cash to get drivers to change their habits.

headline.seo: Experimental Campaigns Pay Drivers to Avoid Rush-Hour Traffic
headline.main: Incentives for Drivers Who Avoid Traffic Jams
